references.paper_title: Protein interface prediction using graph convolutional networks
references.reason: This paper is a pioneering work in applying graph convolutional networks to protein interface prediction, which is the focus of the current research.

references.paper_title: End-to-end learning on 3d protein structure for interface prediction
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant as it also uses deep learning for protein interface prediction, providing a strong baseline for comparison and advancement.

references.paper_title: Hierarchical graph learning for protein-protein interaction
references.reason: This is a very recent paper by one of the co-authors, demonstrating their continued work in protein graph representation learning for similar problems.

references.paper_title: Highly accurate protein structure prediction with AlphaFold
references.reason: AlphaFold2 is used extensively in the current research, and this paper is crucial for understanding its capabilities and limitations.

references.paper_title: Bernnet: Learning arbitrary graph spectral filters via bernstein approximation
references.reason: This paper introduces BernNet, which is a key component of the proposed ATProt framework, showing its importance to the current research.
